formattedAddress: 331 E 12th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 331 E 12th St, New York, NY 10003-7202, USA

originalText.text: My experience there going in for the first time after registering for services online-,was a real turn off - treated indifferently and as if I was crazy for thinking I might get help as they told  me I was very late -4 pm in the afternoon - I have not returned  -  Luckily I am not very elderly or in need of much help as the message was basically leave us alone

originalText.text:
I went to this center after reopen since last November 2021, but on April 28,2022 I went to the lady's room at first floor. There are four new up to dare bathrooms and nice and clean.
Today May 2, 2022 I went for last class of my movement therapy at 1 P:M and in the morning 9:30-11:30 A:M for mosaic. In between I had lunch. all in person. Everything went well more than I expected. It is my ideal senior center.
Yesterday I went to this center for classes. Therefore, between classes, I had lunch at the center dinning room; this is the second time of in person.
I enjoyed the home made healthy lunch. It made from loving and caring heart from this chef and the management! Thumb up! The presentation of this lunch looked so professional. tasted so good and they are the every food that your body needs.
If I were still very young, I won't post. Because people will start to come to this center more; now, I am old and feel like to do something good for others not only myself!
I will go to 14Y for First Annual Celebrate Arts Festival Presents: Age My Way Friday and Saturday at 1:00 P:M at 14 Y Theater both May 27, and May 28.
I have a good time both days. Looking forward!
Good news is 7/18/2022 this center is going to serve breakfast as before COVID 19!

originalText.text: I went to check it out  the classes for seniors the staff was helpful  and very polite. I participated  in the Thai Chi class  the teacher was great.

text.text: I went to check it out  the classes for seniors the staff was helpful  and very polite. I participated  in the Thai Chi class  the teacher was great.

originalText.text: This is a senior resident facility, serves 3 meals daily that non-resident seniors may also enjoy by paying a nominal fee ($1-3). Activities, trips, & social events abound with atypical NYC amenities, 5☆ restaurants, theatres, thrift, & big store shopping all in walking distance....

text.text: This is a senior resident facility, serves 3 meals daily that non-resident seniors may also enjoy by paying a nominal fee ($1-3). Activities, trips, & social events abound with atypical NYC amenities, 5☆ restaurants, theatres, thrift, & big store shopping all in walking distance....

originalText.text: Very active senior center. They offer cafeteria style breakfast, lunch, and dinner for a minimal contribution Monday through Friday. On one level, they have Project Ore, which offers kosher meals to it's members (membership is free but is separate from Sirovich). Sirovich has a number of activities, keyed to many different interests, scheduled daily throughout the week.
